content.description: Standing start on the left side, come around the corner and work your way up the arete to the top of the boulder. Start on double hand crimp. Fun and easy, not a lot of risk, handholds are brushed and solid.
content.location: Looking directly at the two boulders, find the obvious lane where you walk between the two rocks. Look up at the flat pitch to a high ledge where you crimp to start.

content.description: Lots of potential Routes. Crash pads needed. There are two large granite boulders here. Clearly used to be one larger boulder that split into two. Pretty shady, lots of potential for routes. Standing start on the left side, move around the corner and continue up. Top out is dirty and likely needs to be cleaned every time you go. Pretty easy warmup climb, not a destination, more of a fun thing to do while hiking on the trail.
